snippet: A ceremony was called off at the last minute after President Hamid Karzai rejected some measures of the deal, including an American veto over any release.
abstract: Transfer of nearly 4,000 Afghan prisoners held at Bagram Prison from American to Afghan custody is called off by the American military commander, General Joseph F Dunford Jr, at the last minute, after Pres Hamid Karzai rejects several important provisions in the transfer agreement.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and CHARLIE SAVAGE
byline.contributor: Rod Nordland reported from Kabul, and Charlie Savage from Washington. Thom Shanker and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: A ceremony was called off at the last minute after President Hamid Karzai rejected some measures of the deal, including an American veto over any release.

headline.seo: U.S. Delays Transfer of Bagram Prison to Afghan Forces
headline.main: U.S. Again Delays Transfer of Bagram Prison to Afghan Forces
headline.print_headline: U.S. Again Delays Transfer of Bagram Prison to Afghan Forces
